story.title: Our Heritage
story.subtitle: From Pioneer Beginnings to a Lakeside Sanctuary
story.content: Dalai Eej is more than a destination; it is a legacy. Rooted in the history of Khuvsgul’s early days, our resort stands as a testament to the enduring beauty of the Mongolian wilderness. What began as a pioneering spirit on these shores has evolved into a heritage site where the stories of the past meet the quiet stillness of the present.

mission.label: Our Stewardship
mission.quote: To protect the sanctity of the shoreline and share the honest beauty of our home with the world.
mission.content: We are the keepers of this corner of the National Park. Our mission is to honor Mongolian heritage by providing a stay that is both raw and refined—where the warmth of a wood-burning stove and the clarity of the lake water remind us of what is true and lasting.

dining.title: Flavors of the Steppe
dining.desc: Experience warm Mongolian hospitality. From hearty Khorkhog to fresh European favorites, our restaurant serves delicious meals prepared with local ingredients. Enjoy your morning coffee while watching the sunrise over the lake.

activities.title: Adventures on the Blue Pearl
activities.desc: The lake is your playground. Charter a motorboat to the islands, hike the surrounding larch forests, or experience the nomadic lifestyle on a guided horse trek through the valley.

relaxation.title: Disconnect to Reconnect
relaxation.desc: Far from the city lights and noise. Spend your evenings by a crackling bonfire, gazing at the Milky Way, or relaxing in our wood-fired sauna after a day of exploration.

review1.text: Waking up to the sound of the waves and the smell of pine trees was magical. The heritage cabin was cozy and warm even on chilly nights.
review1.author: Sarah J., USA

review2.text: The staff went above and beyond to help us organize a trip to the Reindeer herders. Truly the highlight of our Mongolia trip.
review2.author: Bat-Erdene, Ulaanbaatar

review3.text: Perfect location. Right on the water, but quiet and peaceful. The food at the restaurant was surprisingly good for such a remote spot!
review3.author: Alex & Marie, France
